contentrichtext.text: {{For|others with the same or similar names|John Rennie (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Governor General |name = John Shaw Rennie |honorific-suffix = [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]] [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] |image = |order = [[List of Governors-General of Mauritius|Governor General of Mauritius]] |monarch = [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Elizabeth II]] |primeminister = [[Seewoosagur Ramgoolam]] |term_start = 12 March 1968 |term_end = 3 September 1968 |predecessor = Position established |successor = [[Leonard Williams (politician)|Leonard Williams]] |birth_date = 1917 |birth_place = |death_date = 2002 {{citation needed|date=December 2012}} |death_place = }} Sir '''John Shaw Rennie''', [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]], [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] (12 January 1917, [[Glasgow]] - 12 August 2002) was a British civil servant, [[UNRWA]]'s Commissioner-General from 1971 to 1977.<ref name=Schiff>Benjamin N. Schiff, ''Refugees Unto the Third Generation: UN Aid to Palestinians'', (Syracuse, NY: Syracuse University Press, 1995), p. 293.</ref> John Rennie was educated at [[Hillhead High School]], [[Glasgow University]] and [[Balliol College, Oxford]]. In 1951 Rennie was appointed Britain's deputy colonial secretary for [[Mauritius]].<ref name=WhoWasWho>[http://www.ukwhoswho.com/view/article/oupww/whowaswho/U32301 RENNIE, Sir John Shaw], ''[[Who Was Who]]'', A & C Black, 1920–2008; online edn, Oxford University Press, Dec 2007, accessed 19 Dec 2010</ref> He was the British [[Resident (title)|Resident]] in [[Vanuatu]] from 1955 to 1962.<ref>http://www.worldstatesmen.org/Vanuatu.html</ref> From 1962 to 1968 he was [[Governor of Mauritius]], overseeing Mauritius' transition to independence. From 1968 to 1971 Rennie was UNRWA deputy Commissioner-General under [[Laurence Michelmore]], who persuaded then-U.N. Secretary-General [[U Thant]] to appoint Rennie as his successor.<ref>[http://amarillo.com/stories/100302/usn_globalobits.shtml Around the World], 3 October 2002</ref> {{S-start}} {{s-gov}} {{Succession box |title = [[List of colonial heads of Vanuatu (New Hebrides)|Governor of Vanuatu]] |before = Hubert Flaxman |after = Alexander Mair Wilkie |years = 1955–1962 }} {{Succession box |title = [[Governor of Mauritius]] |before = [[Colville Deverell]] |after = Position abolished |years = 1962–1968 }} {{Succession box |title = [[List of Governors-General of Mauritius|Governor General of Mauritius]] |before = Position established |after = [[Leonard Williams (politician)|Leonard Williams]] |years = 1968 }} {{S-end}} == References == <references/> {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Rennie, John Shaw | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Governor-General of Mauritius | PLACE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF DEATH = | DATE OF BIRTH= 12 January 1917 | DATE OF DEATH= 12 August 2002 }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rennie, John Shaw}} [[Category:1917 births]] [[Category:2002 deaths]] [[Category:British Governors of Mauritius]] [[Category:Governors-General of Mauritius]] [[Category:Colonial Administrative Service officers]] [[Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire]]
